{"step_by_step_thinking": "Erythropoietin is a hormone produced primarily by the kidneys. It has a key role in the production of red blood cells (erythropoiesis), stimulating their production by acting on the progenitor cells in the bone marrow. The progenitor cells that erythropoietin acts on are the Colony Forming Units (CFU) and Burst Forming Units (BFU). However, it has a more direct effect on CFU.", "answer_choice": "A. CFU"}
